channel.title: Lecture Notes on MIT OpenCourseWare
channel.description: Recent content in Lecture Notes on MIT OpenCourseWare

item.title: ch11.pdf
item.description: Handwritten lecture notes on switching losses and snubbers, simple RCD turn-off snubbers, and simple RCD turn-on snubbers.

item.title: ch12.pdf
item.description: Handwritten lecture notes on soft switching techniques, CS/ZVS techniques, and DC/DC converter applications.

item.title: ch13.pdf
item.description: Handwritten lecture notes on convection, conduction, radiation, heat sinking, and thermal modeling.

item.title: ch14.pdf
item.description: Handwritten lecture notes on input and output ripple and electromagnetic interference filtering.

item.title: ch15.pdf
item.description: Handwritten lecture notes on three-phase systems, three-phase rectifiers, and higher-order rectifiers.

item.title: ch16.pdf
item.description: Handwritten lecture notes on resonant power conversion, resonant circuit review, class D amplifiers, class E converters, resonant gate drives, multi-stage amplifiers, and RF power circuits.

item.title: ch3.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on power factor, total harmonic distortion, passive power factor compensation, and the displacement factor component of power factor.

item.title: ch4.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on phase-controlled rectifiers, thyristor devices, and silicon controlled rectifiers.

item.title: ch5.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on DC/DC converters, Kirchhoff’s voltage law, Kirchhoff’s current law, and periodic steady state conditions.

item.title: ch6.pdf
item.description: Handwritten lecture notes with an introduction to magnetics, Ampere’s law, Faraday’s law, flux continuity, the design of an inductor, flux computation, reluctance models, transformers, and inductor design tips.

item.title: ch7.pdf
item.description: Handwritten lecture notes on isolated DC/DC converters, flyback converters, single?ended forward converters, multiple outputs from isolated converters, transformer leakage inductances, and double?ended converters.

item.title: ch8.pdf
item.description: Handwritten lecture notes on modeling and control, direct circuit averaging, state-space averaging, linearization, and control design.

item.title: ch9.pdf
item.description: Handwritten lecture notes on Fourier series review, inverter structure, programmed PWM, harmonic cancellation, multi-level converters, sine-triangle PWM, and inverter current control techniques.

item.title: chp1.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on switching power electronics, analysis of techniques, and periodic steady state.

item.title: chp2.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on rectifiers, load regulation, and analysis methods.

item.title: content.pdf
item.description: Title page and table of contents from the course lecture notes.

item.title: Lecture Notes
item.description:
AC = alternate current
DC = direct current

Title page and table of contents (PDF)

CHAPTERS TOPICS
1 Introduction and analysis methods (PDF)
2 Introduction to rectifiers (PDF)
3 Power factor and measures of distortion (PDF)
4 Phase-controlled rectifiers (PDF)
5 Introduction to DC/DC converters (PDF)
6 Introduction to magnetics (PDF - 2.0 MB)
7 Isolated DC/DC converters (PDF)
8 Modeling and control (PDF - 1.9 MB)
